bug.author: treuille
bug.summary: URLError "Unable to get local issuer certificate" when running the Uber NYC Demo
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h1>Summary</denchmark-h>
One of our users rand the Uber NYC Demo and saw the following error: <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1673013/66634994-954c1780-ec0e-11e9-9649-3c6be14ea2c1.png></denchmark-link>
After some digging around, this seems like <denchmark-link:https://stackoverflow.com/questions/52805115/certificate-verify-failed-unable-to-get-local-issuer-certificate>an issue with some versions of Python on MacOS</denchmark-link> . It can also be unsafely solved by setting as described <denchmark-link:https://stackoverflow.com/questions/22027418/openssl-python-requests-error-certificate-verify-failed>here</denchmark-link> . <denchmark-h:h1>Possible Solutions</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-h:h2>Immediate Hack</denchmark-h>
Some Googling suggests that <denchmark-link:https://timonweb.com/tutorials/fixing-certificate_verify_failed-error-when-trying-requests_html-out-on-mac/>this procedure</denchmark-link> may work for make users. <denchmark-h:h2>Longer Term Solution</denchmark-h>
In the long run, perhaps we can solve this issues by providing our own and as described in <denchmark-link:https://github.com/streamlit/streamlit/issues/375>this feature request</denchmark-link> . <denchmark-h:h1>Debug info</denchmark-h>
If any users have seen this error, please reply in the comments with the following information.
Streamlit version: (get it with $ streamlit version) Python version: (get it with $ python --version) Using Conda? PipEnv? PyEnv? Pex? OS version: Browser version:

Update from that user. He had old SSL certificates installed. When he fixed that Streamlit worked! :) Nevertheless, I think it would be good if we tried to solve this for our users (<denchmark-link:https://github.com/streamlit/streamlit/issues/375>#375</denchmark-link> ).

Just for the sake of issue board cleanliness, I'm closing this bug since it's not really a problem with Streamlit per se. The link from <denchmark-link:https://github.com/streamlit/streamlit/issues/375>#375</denchmark-link> which is still open will help provide context.

I realize that this issue is closed, but I had the same problem and wanted to provide the requested information in case it is helpful. Streamlit version: 0.56.0 Python version: 3.7.3 Using Conda? PipEnv? PyEnv? Pex?: Pipenv OS version: macOS Catalina 10.15.3 Browser version: Firefox 73.0.1 (64 bit) My workaround was the download the CSV and use local paths to load it. Hopefully, I won't run into an SSL certificate problem when I try to build my own app, but if I do, you'll be hearing from me! :)
